reviews.review_msg: Probably my favourite professor. GEOG 104 was sometimes a bit dull in content, but it was designed to help you relate to your place in the world. You could choose a topic you wanted to research, which made the assignments more interesting. She genuinely cares about students' learning, and you can see that in her teaching style.

He really tried, and I'm sure he's a nice person but the course was really dry (lol no pun intended). I don't think he was the problem, I think it was that good-awful TA who literally deducted points for font size on a poster. Other than that, no textbook and relatively easy concepts, for some reason though, people didn't really do well.
easy courses with weekly quizzes and assignments, but it takes 48hrs for the prof to reply to my email about the final project, cuz the instructions are bit confused and unclear.
Weekly lecture videos and discussion/activities that take around an hour to do. The projects and exams were very straightforward. Lecture videos are also nice and short.

Leanne is a very flexible prof with a 3 day extension on every other assignment. Each week there was one very short lecture and a simple quiz after. One thing that sucked was the marking. The TA's were sometimes very picky and for the poster project your group members decided your mark and you can't do anything about it.

Her online class was very well-structured and clearly laid out. She marked fairly and the assignments were straight-forward. Only thing I didn't really like was the novel study, but she gave ample time between check-ins so it wasn't too bad. Overall would recommend this course!

Course was pretty easy and straightforward, especially with no final, however, don't expect an A+ or anything because that is virtually impossible due to the small rooms for error you can have on some of the heavily weighted assesments
P.S the textbook readings are useless i didn't open it once
Leanne was a good prof and the course was not overly difficult. She was also very accommodating.

Honestly surprised at how low her rating is !! You have to read the course material and watch the lectures to do well in this class, but all the material is interesting so it's not too difficult. Dr. Roderick also goes out of her way to make the course better for students (ex. changing things about the tests after student feedback).
Easy and light class with 2 major assignments, just watch lectures and memorize the concept and you're good to go

It was an easy class overall, with only a couple big assignments. I DID NOT read a textbook at all and did not go to optional zoom meetings. Just watched her slides, it was enough.

A few assignments took a while to write so make sure to start early. She gave us enough time (even too much) to do them. The easiest class I have even taken.

Had to take this class to fulfill my degree-related social science/science breadth requirements as part of graduation. By far, my worst class grade-wise this term given how awful this prof was since she expected the students to come in with 300-400 level stuff knowledge.

Pretty straightforward course, as long as you review lecture slides and study the learning goals you will do fine. Dr. Roderick was an amazing professor, she was caring and even gave us a 1% bonus for completing the course review survey. Assignments weren't too difficult and I learned a lot about our climate in this course. Highly Recommend!

Content is straightforward/prof is passionate and caring. TAs grade harshly sometimes, just focus on meeting criteria in rubrics and ur good. I got the textbook but didn't do any readings b/c lecture content overlapped with them. Do the other readings/short vids tho! Study for quizzes/final using weekly learning goals and you'll get an easy A.

Lots of smaller assignments that are effort-based to help ensure you understand the big concepts. The prof was understanding whenI found myself in a tight spot with meeting deadlines.  A lot of what people are complaining about are beyond the prof's control - e.g. an online exam for 400 students would crash the Canvas server.

Took this course as an elective thinking it'd be easy for a 100 level but it's my worst class this sem because I couldn't understand anything. Leanne reads off the slides, not explaining concepts in depth. Worked hard on my poster project and got 50% on it without proper feedback. Also an in person final for an online class at 7-10pm is insane !!

Dr. Roderick is super nice and seems to genuinely care about her students. However, the lectures were uninformative and she just read off slides. Most issues (large class size of 400, and inconsistent marking by TAs) are genuinely out of her control for the most part. She's a great person but it's unfortunate that the course was not.

This course is meant to be easy as 100 level, but I will add on to other people, she along with her TAs confused us so much. To this day, I do not know what she or TAs expect from us, so lost studying for the exam. The readings and videos all seem to cover the same idea but are phrased differently, don't know how much detail I have to memorize.

They expect us to know 400 level stuff and marked my assignments acc to that, I do not know who gave her TEACHING EXCELLENCE AWARD, I mean, she reads off Tara Holland's slides. Is that reasonable? This GPA booster took more of my time as compared to my 400 level business courses, PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF OR THE COURSE, TAKE OTHER COURSES!!!

WORST PROFESSOR EVER! If you think this will be a GPA booster, please rethink. Worst prof, worst course, hell TAs. Do not take this course ever! 3 major assignments and the grading was unclear, TAs expect us to know 300-400 level stuff that we are supposed to know for a 100 level course, I mean, al least be reasonable!!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS AS A GPA BOOSTER. You will not get above 80%. So many articles and textbook pages to read WEEKLY. Absolutely atrocious. An online class with an in-person exam that is cumulative. Terrible terrible TERRIBLE. STAY AWAYYYYYYYYY

Tedious class with so many little things due every week on top of lectures, alongside unclear grading criteria. It's my last semester, and this is one of the most tedious workloads I have ever had for a class. Prof introduces assignments in the week it's due, which is not helpful at all when you are balancing other courses. Would not recommend!

Weekly class engagement act. were for 1% but considering how tedious they were, should have been like 30%. Quizzes were so hard, I studied for the whole week and still got 8/11. Unclear questions and 'choose all that apply' made it worse. Never recommend class with this professor, please don't think its a gpa booster because it is not!!

This "GPA-boosting" elective has consumed so much of my time from the weekly participation, quizzes and assignments, more than my upper-level classes. The lecture is useless. Quizzes feel tedious. The canvas page is so painful to go through. TAs are hard markers. Textbook readings + many mini articles + engagements are assigned every. week.

Worst class I've ever taken at SFU (I'm in 3rd year). Everything was graded super unfairly, the class has so many people that the TAs don't wanna deal with people complaining about marks. I don't know why people say this is an easy A! Such ridiculous assignments (and a lot of them)! Unorganized class, wrong dates on canvas, I could go on...

The professor for this class directly reads off the slides and uses all the course material by Dr. Tara Holland. I understand running a course can be difficult but atleast not read directly off the slides or have so many things due each week. Since this class is online yet we have an in-person final exam covering the whole course.

Enthusiastic and engaging professor. However, the course has too many little things due every week on top of lectures to watch and readings which makes the class take more time and work and the final is in-person for an online class.

Dr. Roderick is very nice, makes lectures straightforward and the assignments were fun and interactive. Took this class for WQB credit and really enjoyed it. Definitely recommend Dr. Roderick and the course :)

The course is fairly easy for ppl who don't have science background (like me) as long as you complete all the work. Workload is not that heavy, but is broken down in many little things sometimes.
The prof is accessible through canvas discussion, and she replied in a decent amount of time (sometimes it took her longer).
